content:
The provided code snippet appears within a larger document focused on configuring and managing UI elements related to physics simulation parameters. The specific chunk pertains to setting up float controls in the UI for adjusting scaling factors in a 'Geom Renderer', which is used to define how geometric objects are scaled during rendering.

**Context:**  
The code chunk is part of a section that configures user interface elements for specifying scaling parameters within a geometry renderer, allowing adjustments to X, Y, and Z scale values.

self.createFloater(p, 'Geom Renderer',
                           'Initial X Scale',
                           'Initial X scaling factor',
                           command = self.setRendererGeomInitialXScale)
        self.createFloater(p, 'Geom Renderer',
                           'Final X Scale',
                           'Final X scaling factor, if xScale enabled',
                           command = self.setRendererGeomFinalXScale)
        self.createFloater(p, 'Geom Renderer',
                           'Initial Y Scale',
                           'Initial Y scaling factor',
                           command = self.setRendererGeomInitialYScale)
        self.createFloater(p, 'Geom Renderer',
                           'Final Y Scale',
                           'Final Y scaling factor, if yScale enabled',
                           command = self.setRendererGeomFinalYScale)
        self.createFloater(p, 'Geom Renderer',
                           'Initial Z Scale',
